snippet: The main stock indexes closed down about 1 percent after the Labor Department said employers hired at a weaker-than-anticipated pace in June.
abstract: Stocks decline on Wall Street as new unemployment data in the United States indicates tepid job growth, sending financial markets another signal about the pace of the economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: The main stock indexes closed down about 1 percent after the Labor Department said employers hired at a weaker-than-anticipated pace in June.

headline.seo: Wall Street Sags on U.S. Jobs Report
headline.main: Shares Are Lower on Weak Jobs Data
headline.print_headline: Shares Are Lower on Weak Jobs Data
